name: PuTTY Private Key File
summary: Learn about .PPK files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: PPK files are used by PuTTY, a free SSH and Telnet client. To set the PPK file for authentication, choose Connection → SSH → Auth from the PuTTY Configuration menu and then select Browse... for the "Private key file for authentication" option.

NOTE: PPK files can also be opened using WinSCP, an SFTP and FTP client for Windows. You can set the PPK file location when creating a new connection in WinSCP by selecting Advanced → SSH → Authentication → Private key file.
